962EBE8198CD4169B0401B99A22F5ED6.description:
Analyze how computational thinking and
computer programing can be used as tools for
problem solving.

4630FB1D3E5445C8BC18E16A5645F871.description:
Apply responsible legal and ethical behaviors
in the use of technology systems and
software.

BBC7C12F1649453B999CE3A0EDBFD7F5.description:
Use productivity technology tools for
individual and collaborative writing,
communication, presentation, and/or
publishing activities.

F80889AE1A8B4E278E5F07FA2D4B3ECC.description:
Implement problem solutions using a
programming language.

30B22F3D502047DA99E4BA3F98224280.description:
Use modeling and simulation to represent and
understand natural phenomena.

43B7069E546A49E0A5A06EF492A752F5.description:
Use the basic steps in algorithmic problem
solving to design solutions to problems.

A5EA7212705A401E81A1D23F1171993A.description:
Select and use appropriate tools and
technology resources to accomplish a variety
of tasks and solve problems.

6147EAD6FC304D35A814D2A909BBBA73.description:
Computational Thinking and Computer Science Applications - Students will be able to apply computational thinking skills and computer science
applications as tools to develop solutions to engineering problems.

ADDE33C18F594FF9A0DEE57F07B1CF8E.description: Design and create models of structures.

C27A9D9F82804BA394BA1E10A93F19A7.description: Design, use, and assess building material.

D26C45D612EF47E29298D82FB82EE5F4.description:
Assess the role that community planning,
laws, and regulation have in the
development and maintenance of
structures.

FC4BD92816F8465DBD2F68C166AB5AAB.description:
Analyze the maintenance of structures and
subsystems.

C460A1860F41457582C7CAF68E09C422.description:
Analyze factors used in the selection of
designs for structures (e.g. laws, codes,
style, cost, climate, function) (STL, 20F).

D56B7806BDE74FBDB1324EEA5EBF6085.description:
Analyze the type of and purpose for a
variety of structures.

E42637E4FF804FECB6C113E373D1C7DA.description:
Assess a variety of manufacturing
methodologies.

4BF41BF010804FF6B15C90A3B6DB9748.description:
Classify manufactured goods according to
their longevity.

CA4AD9C3EA8A47BAA85883604E668D1A.description:
Assess the impact that the manufacturing
process has on people and the environment.

2E21D1395EFD4F88888B48BF7EBBC6BF.description:
Assess the impact that technology (e.g.
computer-aided design, automation, robots,
assembly lines) has on the manufacturing
process.

2FB71702BE424EDC817927D10AEEA662.description:
Analyze the development, production,
application, marketing, acquisition, and
disposal of manufactured products.

00543EA6559644A38F6F9E22F87AB414.description:
Examine the mechanical and chemical
processes of manufacturing.

59F5021C2AAD42408A942AA3C24A776B.description:
Identify resources required for
manufacturing systems to operate properly
(e.g. raw materials, finances, people, tools,
machines, time).

ECBDB448079547C8B2407AE9EDF647D5.description:
Identify the components of a manufacturing
system.

9DA6BBD055FC4AC480AB8280EA674D7A.description:
Describe how governmental regulations
influence the design and operation of
transportation system.

588BD46FB2E3480D8629FC753789AB25.description:
Design and develop a model of a new energy
efficient vehicle to be use on land, in the
sea, in the air, or in space.

BB6D799D35A54AE9B9D93AAEF95CB007.description:
Design and develop models of subsystems in
a transportation system (structural,
propulsion, suspension, guidance, control,
and support).

ADB3F88AC77645408AC330955F9E7FDE.description:
Analyze the interdependence of
transportation systems.

8B4141E582DE468187F86439F0731683.description:
Assess processes necessary for an entire
transportation system to operate efficiently
(e.g. receiving, holding, storing, loading)
(STL, 18I).

0CE28CFD23C74C058A00999199EFF3E8.description:
Investigate the functionality of various
methods of transportation for land, water,
air, and space.

2F8058F67B57452F89E0C8270E1A48D9.description:
Design and develop a simple
communications system.

C6B48632436B430BB8601621615D6E03.description:
Design and send messages using various
types of communication systems.

A46B5F706A9A4D3DA16C91B384801041.description:
Explore different steps in the
communication process (encode message,
encoded message is transmitted or switched
through a channel, message is received and
decoded by the receiver).

E33B098501DD4299AB1ED7D3C3632280.description:
Assess the application and functionality of
the parts of a communication system
(source, encoder, transmitter, receiver,
decoder, and destination) (STL, 17H).

76051ED121D743F0BA751309FD0BFE22.description:
Assess advantages and disadvantages of
different forms of renewable and
nonrenewable energy.

5F23D87656A04096893E35D33C9B8472.description:
Design, construct, and test a device that
either minimizes or maximizes energy
transfer (MS-PS3-3).

B3C5DE5E6FA04CB8A6A51A3D5E9DFE43.description:
Analyze how power systems are used to
drive and provide propulsion to other
technological products and systems (STL,
16H).

6AC05C16A51A45F7954C0052061BFA3B.description:
Analyze ethical, societal, and legal issues
that arise from biotechnology applications.

9ADCF4ECDA624705B36F28A52219ABDD.description:
Examine positive and negative impacts of
biotechnology.

141F3571A16440E7B97A68B563064855.description:
Describe techniques used to provide longterm storage of food and reduce the health
risk caused by tainted food (STL, 15J).

DE0DA8129F984BE699FB6160A8F4F7CF.description:
Evaluate the positive and negative effects of
technological solutions to agricultural
problems.

BEC01C6950AF4ACFA3433813949005B7.description:
Design, develop, use, manage, maintain, and
assess a closed system that supports living
organisms (e.g. terrarium, hydroponics
station).

4ADCE473CCA74AAC9EAD47FD53B9DCB7.description:
Explore the function and application of a
variety of technological processes,
equipment, and systems used in agriculture
(e.g. agroforestry, irrigation, global
positioning systems).

B23EB90E57AB4E3E8070271A13789724.description:
Describe ethical considerations involved in
the development and application of medical
technologies.

1059AF36B6734C4ABFB87FD5BE3891AA.description:
Correlate advances in medical technologies
to improvements in the length and quality of
life for multicellular organisms.

EA0CE2F446BF4C8C810ECF29A62814D4.description:
Explore the function and application of
several medical technologies.

35AA686DFB564BF0ACB3DC7EEC697A94.description:
Core Technologies and The Designed World - Students will demonstrate knowledge of the core technologies that underpin the designed world and
major enterprises that produce the goods and services of the designed world. Core technologies include but are not limited to biotechnology, electrical, electronics,
fluid, material, mechanical, optical, structural, and thermal technologies. Major enterprises include medical, agriculture, biotechnology, energy and power,
information and communication, transportation, and manufacturing and construction technologies.

1A22D1DD48AD4BBB9D3BBD0FE45C36E5.description:
Analyze the function of select core
technologies in the designed world.

0DDC8F2677594909A3BA95642F4AB8D5.description:
Discriminate between ethical and unethical
engineering practices.

29E60C3F853E4F8BB0E305EB528D4714.description:
Evaluate competing design solutions using a
systematic process to determine how well
they meet the criteria and constraints of a
problem (MS-ETS1-2).

628CF0628DA548BD90AE88094163D98B.description:
Assess the reliability and validity of
researched information.

9543E840F02B43AEB6E84919F6D127ED.description:
Document the design process and solutions in
a journal, notebook, or portfolio.

49A9384BD2FD404785E7571891083C6A.description:
Apply the design process to develop solutions
to real-world problems.

6B5B7694D9AA4446A705D6D8B9DD6FAD.description:
Communicate Processes and Results –
students will be able to communicate throughout
the design process demonstrating application of
the essential skills and knowledge presented in
Maryland’s College and Career Ready Disciplinary
Literacy Standards.

311BD8BE97284ED09A1AB603EF5565FD.description:
Creating or Making the Product – students
will be able to produce the design product

B637EB6D08924DCC9A601705E6391DCF.description: Refining a Design – student will employ data-driven decision making to improve their product.

DF0AE893BD054C92B4E87A927B93A04D.description:
Testing and Evaluating Design Using
Specifications – students will be able to use
establish specifications to assess their design
product.

F7B4C2FC635A45C993B16E00DA864E33.description:
Making a Model or a Prototype – students
will be able to develop conceptual, mathematical,
or physical models and/or a prototype that
performs the final solution and can be used for
testing/evaluating. This includes the creation of
two and three dimensional scale drawings.

A24E6CDD92524EC58C5F4367BB9DEBD2.description:
Developing a Design Proposal – students
will be able to create a plan of action that details
the specifics of the project.

B0BF14648A34459BBA27F8B33671E67D.description:
Selecting an Approach – students will be able
to employ a decision matrix to select the best
approach to solve the problem.

0B73E292203E4995BAE25FE257564BD2.description:
Exploring Possibilities – students will conduct
research and explore possibilities for potential
solutions.

C85F5DF661B74419BB944DE2BB493F87.description:
Identifying Criteria and Specifying
Constraints – students will be able to assess the
criteria (guidelines) and prioritize constraints
(limitations) of the problem. This includes people,
time, materials, capital, energy, etc.

64EB7EEB57F145BB8A1DC970B96901D5.description:
Researching and Generating Ideas –
students will be able to conduct research to assess
prior solutions to the problem.

9769B71D349F4519B65346565ECCD952.description:
Brainstorming – students will be able to apply
team brainstorming rules and techniques.

7760CA0670044FACBF79B8869442DC6C.description:
Defining a problem – students will be able to
employ technical reading and writing skills to
develop concise problem statement.

58FC0EE5E4EB46FAB9697287936798CA.description:
Explain how the design process is an iterative,
systematic approach to problem solving that
includes collaboratively:

B64F3F8455804B769635EBF7E66EE73A.description:
Engineering Design and Development - Students will demonstrate knowledge of and apply the engineering design process to develop solutions to
problems.

EB3AED689A654BDD990D02F9152A6C69.description:
Explain how technological advances have
impacted the nature of work.

87FE82CCC364417D8D8A0698C72489D1.description:
Assess the impact that technological
invention and innovation has on the needs
and wants of a society (STL, 4E).

DE5E0ADB4C044CF591BD8D31E1AF5FAA.description:
Describe how new technologies have
evolved as a result of combing existing
technologies.

4A67BCB64BD34850BD17E0DB368380EF.description:
Role of Society in the Development and Use of
Technology

214E937807F2490996588B0F1C5CFAC2.description:
Evaluate the advantages and disadvantages
of technology.

861A3D77B0224E528AC13341405A91A8.description:
Assess the impact of technology transfer
from one society to another (STL, 4K).

F6FE96461A654316A46D7CF309B2E45C.description:
Explain that decisions about the use of
technology involve trade-offs between
positive and negative effects (STL, 4I).

649B5F30B05648DE9EDA8D48E2A98F3A.description:
Describe legal and ethical concerns resulting
from the development and use of technology
(STL, F).

EA70655AC41E4D63B6E355EA898A45EB.description:
Analyze the cultural, social, economic,
political and environmental effects of
technology.

C0F67E00F1B648A8B57942A8F9C281B4.description:
Discriminate between responsible and
irresponsible use of technology.

19BB9A9FA17E41E5BDB76B86F852CD08.description:
Impacts of Technology - Students will evaluate the impact of technology.
The impact of technology incorporates

FF8B6C4FB9274117B43EB9CBECA66150.description:
Assess the limitations of open source
technology.

A607E8B8A0BD4372A6B0F1C747D2B8B3.description:
Describe how patents protect intellectual
property (STL, 3I).

188BC251C2534E2FB5C12E09B5FD655F.description:
Analyze how knowledge gained from other fields
of study has impacted the development of
technological products and systems (STL, 3F).

88A77E8224BD44F79E79147DF92E9881.description:
Connections Between Technology and Other Fields
of Study

72E78068103D4AFBBBA41A7D44F23749.description:
Provide examples of optimization and trade-offs
for products, processes, and systems.

D0985F27AE9544CF8FD601DF0CD7CE35.description:
Use tools, materials, and machines safely to
diagnose, adjust and repair systems (STL, 12I).

5819DD1D38A040A484A1D201A20F8F7A.description:
Analyze the performance of a feedback control
system.

8012B5BAF85A4F5EAABE02CEA9C7A9AB.description:
Assemble and operate simple technological
systems.

E2680F4D0DF346D78C20A5F98025B5D0.description:
Select or design a technological system to
perform a task based on specific requirements.

1F5FC39A693944149B7885E3D94B4577.description:
Design a model that demonstrates how
subsystems and system elements interact within
systems.

29A59A0732B144BD92C73DCDE5AEE3EB.description:
Describe the components of a technological
system.

0DF8878936A5442FA317C7D5462F32BC.description:
Describe how marketing and advertising is used
to create demand for technological products
(STL, 3I).

DF0F30F00E964B1C8DE0083CC7FF674B.description:
Identify the need for technological invention and
innovation.

3A9496E71C514D70994BED5220178A7D.description:
Differentiate between technological inventions
and innovations.

675EFEB9985949E3B1860EB709BAE482.description: The characteristics and scope of technology.

FE535ADA67DA498E943FF1C5B3C63793.description: The Nature of Technology - Students will develop an understanding of the nature of technology.
